spring:
30 # Timeout, in seconds, for borrowing connections from the pool. # Vendor-specific XA properties. # Vendor-specific implementation of XAConnectionFactory. 1 # Minimum size of the pool. 0 # Time, in seconds, that a connection can be pooled for before being destroyed. 0 denotes no limit. true # Whether to ignore the transacted flag when creating session. jmsConnectionFactory # Unique name used to identify the resource during recovery. 0 # Reap timeout, in seconds, for borrowed connections. 0 denotes no limit. 1 # Maximum size of the pool. false # Whether local transactions are desired. 60 # Time, in seconds, after which connections are cleaned up from the pool. 60 # Time, in seconds, between runs of the pool's maintenance thread.
300000ms # Maximum timeout that can be allowed for transactions. tmlog # Transactions log file base name.
10000ms # Delay between two recovery scans. 5 # Number of retry attempts to commit the transaction before throwing an exception. 86400000ms # Delay after which recovery can cleanup pending ('orphaned') log entries. 10000ms # Delay between retry attempts.
true # Whether sub-transactions should be joined when possible. true # Specify whether sub-transactions are allowed. 500 # Interval between checkpoints, expressed as the number of log writes between two checkpoints. 50 # Maximum number of active transactions. # The transaction manager's unique name. false # Whether a VM shutdown should trigger forced shutdown of the transaction core. 10000ms # Default timeout for JTA transactions. # Transaction manager implementation that should be started. 9223372036854775807 # How long should normal shutdown (no-force) wait for transactions to complete. true # Whether to enable disk logging. # Directory in which the log files should be stored. false # Whether to use different (and concurrent) threads for two-phase commit on the participating resources.
0 # Time, in seconds, that a connection can be pooled for before being destroyed. 0 denotes no limit. 1 # Maximum size of the pool. # Default isolation level of connections provided by the pool. # Vendor-specific implementation of XAConnectionFactory. # Vendor-specific XA properties. 60 # Time, in seconds, after which connections are cleaned up from the pool. true # Whether to use concurrent connection validation. dataSource # Unique name used to identify the resource during recovery. 1 # Minimum size of the pool. 30 # Timeout, in seconds, for borrowing connections from the pool. 0 # Reap timeout, in seconds, for borrowed connections. 0 denotes no limit. 60 # Time, in seconds, between runs of the pool's maintenance thread. # SQL query or statement used to validate a connection before returning it. 0 # Timeout, in seconds, for establishing a database connection.
true # Whether TMJOIN should be used when starting XAResources. # Properties that should be set on the underlying implementation. 0 # Maximum size of the pool. 0 denotes no limit. # Underlying implementation class name of the XA resource. true # Whether resources should be enlisted and delisted automatically. false # Whether connections in the ACCESSIBLE state can be shared within the context of a transaction. # Password to use to connect to the JMS provider. false # Whether the transaction manager should allow mixing XA and non-XA transactions. true # Whether the provider can run many transactions on the same connection and supports transaction interleaving. false # Whether this resource is disabled, meaning it's temporarily forbidden to acquire a connection from its pool. 30 # Timeout, in seconds, for acquiring connections from the pool. 1 # Number of connections to create when growing the pool. true # Whether producers and consumers should be cached. 1 # Position that this resource should take during two-phase commit (always first is Integer.MIN_VALUE, always last is Integer.MAX_VALUE). 0 # Minimum size of the pool. 1 # Time, in seconds, to wait before trying to acquire a connection again after an invalid connection was acquired. false # Whether connections should be tested when acquired from the pool. 60 # Time, in seconds, after which connections are cleaned up from the pool. jmsConnectionFactory # Unique name used to identify the resource during recovery. false # Whether the transaction timeout should be set on the XAResource when it is enlisted. # User to use to connect to the JMS provider. false # Whether recovery failures should be ignored.
60 # Default transaction timeout, in seconds. btm2.tlog # Name of the second fragment of the journal. 60 # Maximum amount of seconds the TM waits for transactions to get done before aborting them at shutdown time. # ResourceLoader configuration file name. false # Whether to allow multiple LRC resources to be enlisted into the same transaction. false # Skip corrupted transactions log entries. disk # Name of the journal. Can be 'disk', 'null', or a class name. true # Whether to recover only the current node. # JNDI name of the UserTransaction. 60 # Interval in seconds at which to run the recovery process in the background. false # Whether to enable asynchronously execution of two phase commit. false # Whether to log the creation and commit call stacks of transactions executed without a single enlisted resource. 2 # Maximum size in megabytes of the journal fragments. btm1.tlog # Name of the first fragment of the journal. false # Whether to enable filtering of logs so that only mandatory logs are written. false # Whether to enable JMX support. # ASCII ID that must uniquely identify this TM instance. Defaults to the machine's IP address. true # Whether to log a warning for transactions executed without a single enlisted resource. true # Whether logs are forced to disk. # JNDI name of the TransactionSynchronizationRegistry. # Set the fully qualified name of the exception analyzer implementation to use. true # Whether disk forces are batched.
1 # Time, in seconds, to wait before trying to acquire a connection again after an invalid connection was acquired. false # Whether Connection.isValid() is called when acquiring a connection from the pool. false # Whether this resource is disabled, meaning it's temporarily forbidden to acquire a connection from its pool. false # Whether the transaction timeout should be set on the XAResource when it is enlisted. # Underlying implementation class name of the XA resource. dataSource # Unique name used to identify the resource during recovery. 1 # Position that this resource should take during two-phase commit (always first is Integer.MIN_VALUE, and always last is Integer.MAX_VALUE). # Properties that should be set on the underlying implementation. 30 # Timeout, in seconds, for acquiring connections from the pool. true # Whether resources should be enlisted and delisted automatically. 0 # Minimum size of the pool. false # Whether recovery failures should be ignored. 0 # Target size of the prepared statement cache. 0 disables the cache. 60 # Time, in seconds, after which connections are cleaned up from the pool. # Default cursor holdability for connections. 0 # Maximum size of the pool. 0 denotes no limit. # Default auto-commit mode for local transactions. false # Whether the transaction manager should allow mixing XA and non-XA transactions. 1 # Number of connections to create when growing the pool. # SQL query or statement used to validate a connection before returning it. true # Whether TMJOIN should be used when starting XAResources. # Default isolation level for connections. true # Whether the database can run many transactions on the same connection and supports transaction interleaving. false # Whether connections in the ACCESSIBLE state can be shared within the context of a transaction. # Timeout, in seconds, for establishing a database connection.
true # Whether to enable JTA support. # Transaction manager unique identifier. # Transaction logs directory.
# Data (DML) script resource references. # JNDI location of the datasource. Class, url, username & password are ignored when set. # Password of the database to execute DDL scripts (if different). # Fully qualified name of the connection pool implementation to use. By default, it is auto-detected from the classpath. false # Whether to stop if an error occurs while initializing the database. <*># Commons DBCP2 specific settings </*>
# SQL scripts encoding. ; # Statement separator in SQL initialization scripts. # JDBC URL of the database. # Username of the database to execute DDL scripts (if different).
# Properties to pass to the XA data source. # XA datasource fully qualified name.
# Password of the database to execute DML scripts (if different). # Login password of the database. # Username of the database to execute DML scripts (if different). false # Whether to enable JMX support (if provided by the underlying pool). embedded # Initialize the datasource with available DDL and DML scripts. <*># Tomcat datasource specific settings </*>
# Name of the datasource. Default to "testdb" when using an embedded database. # Login username of the database. all # Platform to use in the DDL or DML scripts (such as schema-${platform}.sql or data-${platform}.sql). # Fully qualified name of the JDBC driver. Auto-detected based on the URL by default. false # Whether to generate a random datasource name. # Schema (DDL) script resource references. <*># Hikari specific settings </*>undefinedundefinedundefinedundefined true # Whether to enable connection requests from multiple execution threads.
# Proxy host the HTTP client should use. # Proxy port the HTTP client should use.
3s # Read timeout. http://localhost:9200 # Comma-separated list of the Elasticsearch instances to use. # Login username. # Login password. 3s # Connection timeout.undefinedundefined http://localhost:9200 # Comma-separated list of the Elasticsearch instances to use. # Credentials username. # Credentials password.undefinedundefinedundefinedundefined # Locale in which to encode mapping. # Whether to force the encoding to the configured charset on HTTP requests and responses. # Whether to force the encoding to the configured charset on HTTP responses. # Whether to force the encoding to the configured charset on HTTP requests. Defaults to true when "force" has not been specified. true # Whether to enable http encoding support. UTF-8 # Charset of HTTP requests and responses. Added to the "Content-Type" header if not set explicitly.undefinedundefined # Preferred JSON mapper to use for HTTP message conversion. By default, auto-detected according to the environment.undefinedundefinedfalse # Whether logging of (potentially sensitive) request details at DEBUG and TRACE level is allowed.undefinedundefinedundefined # Queries default fetch size. # Port of the Cassandra server.
5000ms # Pool timeout when trying to acquire a connection from a host's pool. 30s # Heartbeat interval after which a message is sent on an idle connection to make sure it's still alive. If a duration suffix is not specified, seconds will be used. 120s # Idle timeout before an idle connection is removed. If a duration suffix is not specified, seconds will be used. 256 # Maximum number of requests that get queued if no connection is available.
# Queries serial consistency level. # Socket option: read time out. localhost # Cluster node addresses. false # Enable SSL support. # Name of the Cassandra cluster.
auto # Type of Cassandra repositories to enable.
false # Whether to enable JMX reporting. none # Schema action to take at startup. # Socket option: connection time out. # Keyspace name to use. # Login password of the server. # Login user of the server. none # Compression supported by the Cassandra binary protocol. # Queries consistency level.undefinedundefined
auto # Type of Couchbase repositories to enable.
read-your-own-writes # Consistency to apply by default on generated queries. false # Automatically create views and indexes.undefinedundefined
page # Page index parameter name. _ # Delimiter to be used between the qualifier and the actual page number and size properties. size # Page size parameter name. 20 # Default page size. false # Whether to expose and assume 1-based page number indexes. 2000 # Maximum page size to be accepted. # General prefix to be prepended to the page number and page size parameters.
sort # Sort parameter name. undefinedundefined http://127.0.0.1:8983/solr # Solr host. Ignored if "zk-host" is set. # ZooKeeper host address in the form HOST:PORT.
true # Whether to enable Solr repositories. undefinedundefined # GridFS database name. # Fully qualified name of the FieldNamingStrategy to use. # Database name. # Login user of the mongo server. Cannot be set with URI. # Authentication database name.
auto # Type of Mongo repositories to enable.
# Mongo server host. Cannot be set with URI. mongodb://localhost/test # Mongo database URI. Cannot be set with host, port and credentials. # Login password of the mongo server. Cannot be set with URI. # Mongo server port. Cannot be set with URI.undefinedundefined elasticsearch # Elasticsearch cluster name. # Comma-separated list of cluster node addresses.
true # Whether to enable Elasticsearch repositories.

server: undefinedundefinedfalse # Whether to enable HTTP/2 support, if the current environment supports it.undefinedundefinedundefined-1B # Maximum size of the HTTP post content. When the value is -1, the default, the size is unlimited.undefined# Size of each buffer.undefinedundefinedlog # Log file name suffix.undefinedtrue # Whether to enable access log rotation.undefinedaccess_log. # Log file name prefix.undefined# Undertow access log directory.undefinedfalse # Whether to enable the access log.undefinedcommon # Format pattern for access logs.undefinedundefinedtrue # Whether servlet filters should be initialized on startup.undefined# Number of I/O threads to create for the worker. The default is derived from the number of available processors.undefined# Number of worker threads. The default is 8 times the number of I/O threads.undefined# Amount of time a connection can sit idle without processing a request, before it is closed by the server.undefined# Whether to allocate buffers outside the Java heap. The default is derived from the maximum amount of memory that is available to the JVM.undefinedundefinedundefinedundefined.log # Log file name suffix.undefinedtrue # Whether to enable access log rotation.undefinedaccess_log # Log file name prefix.undefinedtrue # Whether to buffer output such that it is flushed only periodically.undefinedfalse # Whether to defer inclusion of the date stamp in the file name until rotate time.undefinedfalse # Set request attributes for the IP address, Hostname, protocol, and port used for the request.undefinedlogs # Directory in which log files are created. Can be absolute or relative to the Tomcat base dir.undefinedfalse # Enable access log.undefined.yyyy-MM-dd # Date format to place in the log file name.undefinedcommon # Format pattern for access logs.undefinedundefined# Tomcat base directory. If not specified, a temporary directory is used.undefined10000 # Maximum number of connections that the server accepts and processes at any given time.undefined# Amount of time the connector will wait, after accepting a connection, for the request URI line to be presented.undefined2MB # Maximum amount of request body to swallow.undefined# Name of the HTTP header from which the remote IP is extracted. For instance, `X-FORWARDED-FOR`.undefined# Comma-separated list of additional patterns that match jars to ignore for TLD scanning.undefinedUTF-8 # Character encoding to use to decode the URI.undefinedundefinedtrue # Whether static resource caching is permitted for this web application.undefined# Time-to-live of the static resource cache.undefinedundefined# Header that holds the incoming protocol, usually named "X-Forwarded-Proto".undefined100 # Maximum queue length for incoming connection requests when all possible request processing threads are in use.undefinedtrue # Whether requests to the context root should be redirected by appending a / to the path.undefined200 # Maximum amount of worker threads.undefined10s # Delay between the invocation of backgroundProcess methods. If a duration suffix is not specified, seconds will be used.undefined10\.\d{1,3}\.\d{1,3}\.\d{1,3}|\undefinedhttps # Value of the protocol header indicating whether the incoming request uses SSL.undefinedX-Forwarded-Port # Name of the HTTP header used to override the original port value.undefined# Whether HTTP 1.1 and later location headers generated by a call to sendRedirect will use relative or absolute redirects.undefined10 # Minimum amount of worker threads.undefined2MB # Maximum size of the HTTP post content.undefinedundefinedundefinedundefined# Date format to place in log file name.undefined# Log filename. If not specified, logs redirect to "System.err".undefinedGMT # Timezone of the request log.undefineddd/MMM/yyyy:HH:mm:ss Z # Timestamp format of the request log.undefinedfalse # Enable logging of the request cookies.undefinedfalse # Append to log.undefined31 # Number of days before rotated log files are deleted.undefinedfalse # Enable logging of request processing time.undefinedfalse # Enable access log.undefinedfalse # Enable logging of the request hostname.undefined# Locale of the request log.undefinedfalse # Enable extended NCSA format.undefinedundefined# Time that the connection can be idle before it is closed.undefined-1 # Number of acceptor threads to use. When the value is -1, the default, the number of acceptors is derived from the operating environment.undefined-1 # Number of selector threads to use. When the value is -1, the default, the number of selectors is derived from the operating environment.undefined200000B # Maximum size of the HTTP post or put content.undefinedundefinedundefined# Alias that identifies the key in the key store.undefinedTLS # SSL protocol to use.undefined# Enabled SSL protocols.undefined# Password used to access the key in the key store.undefined# Path to the key store that holds the SSL certificate (typically a jks file).undefined# Trust store that holds SSL certificates.undefined# Password used to access the key store.undefined# Provider for the key store.undefined# Type of the trust store.undefinedtrue # Whether to enable SSL support.undefined# Password used to access the trust store.undefined# Client authentication mode.undefined# Supported SSL ciphers.undefined# Type of the key store.undefined# Provider for the trust store.undefinedundefinedundefined2KB # Minimum "Content-Length" value that is required for compression to be performed.undefined# Comma-separated list of user agents for which responses should not be compressed.undefinedfalse # Whether response compression is enabled.undefinedtext/html,text/xml,text/plain,text/css,text/javascript,application/javascript,application/json,application/xml # Comma-separated list of MIME types that should be compressed.undefinedundefinedundefinedundefined# Directory used to store session data.undefinedfalse # Whether to persist session data between restarts.undefinedundefined# Comment for the session cookie.undefined# Session cookie name.undefined# Path of the session cookie.undefined# Domain for the session cookie.undefined# Whether to use "HttpOnly" cookies for session cookies.undefined# Whether to always mark the session cookie as secure.undefined# Maximum age of the session cookie. If a duration suffix is not specified, seconds will be used.undefinedundefined# Session tracking modes.undefined30m # Session timeout. If a duration suffix is not specified, seconds will be used.undefinedundefined<*># Servlet context init parameters.undefined</*>undefinedundefinedundefinedtrue # Whether the JSP servlet is registered.undefined<*># Init parameters used to configure the JSP servlet.undefined</*>undefinedundefinedorg.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServlet # Class name of the servlet to use for JSPs.undefinedundefinedapplication # Display name of the application.undefined# Context path of the application.undefinedundefinedundefinedfalse # Include the "exception" attribute.undefinednever # When to include a "stacktrace" attribute.undefinedundefinedtrue # Whether to enable the default error page displayed in browsers in case of a server error.undefinedundefined/error # Path of the error controller.undefinedundefined8KB # Maximum size of the HTTP message header.undefined# Network address to which the server should bind.undefined8080 # Server HTTP port.undefined# Whether X-Forwarded-* headers should be applied to the HttpRequest.undefined# Time that connectors wait for another HTTP request before closing the connection. When not set, the connector's container-specific default is used. Use a value of -1 to indicate no (that is, an infinite) timeout.undefinedundefined# Connection timeout of the Netty channel.undefinedundefined# Value to use for the Server response header (if empty, no header is sent).undefined
logging: undefinedundefined# Log file name (for instance, `myapp.log`). Names can be an exact location or relative to the current directory.undefined0 # Maximum of archive log files to keep. Only supported with the default logback setup.undefined10MB # Maximum log file size. Only supported with the default logback setup.undefinedundefined%wEx # Conversion word used when logging exceptions.undefinedundefined%5p # Appender pattern for log level. Supported only with the default Logback setup.undefined# Appender pattern for output to a file. Supported only with the default Logback setup.undefined# Appender pattern for output to the console. Supported only with the default Logback setup.undefinedyyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.SSS # Appender pattern for log date format. Supported only with the default Logback setup.undefinedundefined# Location of the log file. For instance, `/var/log`.undefined<*># Log levels severity mapping. For instance, `logging.level.org.springframework=DEBUG`.undefined</*>undefinedundefined# Location of the logging configuration file. For instance, `classpath:logback.xml` for Logback.undefinedfalse # Register a shutdown hook for the logging system when it is initialized.undefined<*># Log groups to quickly change multiple loggers at the same time. For instance, `logging.level.db=org.hibernate,org.springframework.jdbc`.undefined</*>undefinedundefined
